items.title: Doc: how to just iterate over basic html elements?
items.body:
Hi,

I am puzzled by the fact that there seems to be no docs on the simplest of operations, ie, how do i iterate over,
search, etc, basic html elements?

I can easily look for links in the page with links(), i can even regex the links, there is a lot about forms,

but I cannot find any reference in the docs on how i could, for example, capture a simple text or match a paragraph.

Does mechanize lack the ability to do anything if the information I am looking for is in a DIV somewhere, but not in a link or in a form?

Thanks

mechanize._mechanize.FormNotFoundError: no form matching nr 0

items.title: File upload broken on python3
items.body:
On Python 3 (3.5.3) with Mechanize 0.4.5, file upload of an APK file fails with the following error: 
<details>
<summary>Error</summary>

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "put_version.py", line 84, in <module>
    r=b.submit()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 684, in submit
    return self.open(self.click(*args, **kwds))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 674, in click
    request = self.form.click(*args, **kwds)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2262, in click
    self._request_class)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2480, in _click
    return control._click(self, coord, return_type, request_class)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 1520, in _click
    r = form._switch_click(return_type, request_class)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2561, in _switch_click
    req_data = self._request_data()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2544, in _request_data
    mw, encode_data(k), encode_data(v))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 562, in _write_mime_data
    fh.write(file_object.read())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/codecs.py", line 321, in decode
    (result, consumed) = self._buffer_decode(data, self.errors, final)
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode bytes in position 14-15: invalid continuation byte
```
</details>
I add the file to the request like this:

```
b.add_file(
    open(args.file),
    content_type='application/vnd.android.package-archive',
    name='apks', 
    filename=args.file.split('/')[-1])
# Await response
print("Uploading file...")
r=b.submit()
```

The script runs successfully on Python 2.7.13.
Seems like Mechanize is trying to decode a binary file, how to circumvent this?

items.title: Requesocks and mechnize not working
items.body:
Hi so when I use mechanize on its own using python 2.711 everything works. However when I import requesocks then I get this error when trying to submit a form:

  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\html5lib\_inputstream.py", line 4, in <mod
ule>
    from six.moves import http_client, urllib
ImportError: cannot import name urllib

This makes it harder to use proxies in other parts of my code without monkey patching everything with pysocks. That's why I like to use requesocks but it seems the libraries conflict. It would be nice if mechanize had socks support for TOR.

items.title: Support for non-ascii characters in urls?
items.body:
python 2.7.16 (and also 3.x series) introduced a new behaviour of httplib for handling urls containing control characters to fix CVE-2019-9740.
(see these dicussons for more information https://bugs.python.org/issue38216,  https://bugs.python.org/issue36274)

after updating to python 2.7.16 our tests using non-ascii characters in urls fail all of a sudden:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  browser.open('http://nohost:80/thema/Spört')
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/zope/testbrowser/browser.py", line 253, in open
  self.mech_browser.open(url, data)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 203, in open
  return self._mech_open(url, data, timeout=timeout)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 230, in _mech_open
  response = UserAgentBase.open(self, request, data)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_opener.py", line 193, in open
  response = urlopen(self, req, data)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 344, in _open
  '_open', req)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 332, in _call_chain
  result = func(*args)
  File "/home/project/v/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wsgi_intercept/urllib2_intercept/wsgi_urllib2.py", line 34, in http_open
  return self.do_open(WSGI_HTTPConnection, req)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/urllib2.py", line 1195, in do_open
  h.request(req.get_method(), req.get_selector(), req.data, headers)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 1058, in request
  self._send_request(method, url, body, headers)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 1092, in _send_request
  self.putrequest(method, url, **skips)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 945, in putrequest
  % (url, match.group()))
InvalidURL: URL can't contain control characters. '/thema/Sp\xc3\xb6rt' (found at least '\xc3')
```

iiuc the python team decided to include this fix (and necessary changes) in the 2.7 release to make them fail earlier (as compared to have yet another problem to solve when upgrading to 3.X)

iiuc the urllib3 has worked around the issue of httplib being more strict in this PR: https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/pull/

i'd like to ask if you do have any plans to do something similiar in mechanize

items.title: Python3 support information (project site and pypi metadata) can be updated
items.body:
According to https://mechanize.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq.html#which-version-of-python-do-i-need python3 isn't supported. 

Release notes says about python3 support and pypi.org json has record about python 3 support in latest versions.
`
'0.4.3': [
      {
        'comment_text': '',
        'digests': {
          'md5': '3cac491b19435ae1f761af330c4bbe95',
          'sha256': '4e8a7703bef5d43b5c753e64e27451b4e66fdc32554b31f5563ad1a82f3142bc'
        },
        'downloads': -1,
        'filename': 'mechanize-0.4.3-py2.py3-none-any.whl',
        'has_sig': True,
        'md5_digest': '3cac491b19435ae1f761af330c4bbe95',
        'packagetype': 'bdist_wheel',
        'python_version': 'py2.py3',
        'requires_python': None,
        'size': 107969,
        'upload_time': '2019-08-18T08:08:20',
        'url': 'https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/bc/68/5ab6f96dfbdae2182e214cf9cc4790f2810c695c04034cc067b0e4ffa2b7/mechanize-0.4.3-py2.py3-none-any.whl'
      },
`

But classifiers field doesn't have python3 in 'Programming Language' section.

Adding 'Programming Language :: Python :: 3.7' will be helpful while searching on Pypi.org.

items.title: Concerning the copyright/license statement
items.body:
HI Kovid,
I am the maintainer of Calibre in Debian, and I have now set out to take over maintainership of the mechanize package in Debian, too, since the current version is horribly outdated (0.2.something) and does not provide Python3 support.

The first upload was rejected due to a license/copyright conflict. In the `COPYRIGHT` file there is stated that
```
Files: *
Copyright: Copyright (C) 2008-2017 Kovid Goyal, John J Lee, Gisle Aas, Johnny Lee, Andy Lester
License: BSD-3-clause-like
```
but this is in discrepancy to statements in some of the files distributed. This means that the upload was rejected since I assumed that the statement in the `COPYRIGHT` files was correct.

Could you please - in short - clarify the current status? Are all the files now onder BSD-3-clause-like, or only those that don't have an explicit license statement?

Thanks a lot

Norbert

items.title: Please update setup.py to indicate that Python3 is supported
items.body: I have used Mechanize on Python3 and it seems to work perfectly. Could you please update setup.py accordingly?

items.title: http-equiv="refresh" HTML Meta Tag Form Parse Error
items.body:
Hi everyone,

I' using this library. I have a bug. I parse the forms of the site but when the site has <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="x" />  tag, form or forms cannot be found.

Example;

```
<html>
<head>
  <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="300" />
</head>
<body>
  <form action="#" method="POST">

    <input type="email">
    <input type="password" name="pass">
    <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  </form>
</body>
</html>
```
Its my html code.

I'm using this parameter.



        browser = mechanize.Browser()

        browser.set_handle_robots(False)

        browser.set_handle_equiv(True)

        browser.set_handle_redirect(True)

        browser.set_handle_refresh(mechanize._http.HTTPRefreshProcessor(), max_time=1)

        browser.addheaders = [('User-agent', 'Mozilla / 5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit / 537.36(KHTML, '
                               'like Gecko) Chrome / 41.0.2228.0 Safari / 537.36')]


after that.


```
browser.open(site_url)
print(browser.forms())
```

>  []



Actually, I've tried many browser parameter but I couldn't parse forms this meta tag.

items.title: Proxy-Authorisation always enters infinite loop due to case mismatch
items.body:
Whenever we try to  authenticate to a proxy server with a wrong password, mechanize enters an infite loop.

To reproduce:

``` python
browser.set_proxies({"http": "127.0.0.1:3128"})
browser.add_proxy_password("user", "pass")
browser.open("http://www.google.com")
```

error:

> RuntimeError: maximum recursion depth exceeded
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 253, in open
>     return self._mech_open(url_or_request, data, timeout=timeout)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 283, in _mech_open
>     response = UserAgentBase.open(self, request, data)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_opener.py", line 204, in open
>     response = meth(req, response)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 486, in http_response
>     'http', request, response, code, msg, hdrs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_opener.py", line 222, in error
>     result = self._call_chain(*args)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 364, in _call_chain
>     result = func(*args)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 895, in http_error_407
>     authority, req, headers)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 849, in http_error_auth_reqed
>     return self.retry_http_basic_auth(host, req, realm)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 863, in retry_http_basic_auth
>     return self.parent.open(newreq)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 253, in open
>     return self._mech_open(url_or_request, data, timeout=timeout)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 283, in _mech_open
>     response = UserAgentBase.open(self, request, data)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_opener.py", line 204, in open
>     response = meth(req, response)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_urllib2_fork.py", line 486, in http_response
>     'http', request, response, code, msg, hdrs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mechanize/_opener.py", line 222, in error
>     result = self._call_chain(*args)
> ...

cause:
The root-cause is that header names are normalized when adding, but that a non-normalized lookup is performed to prevent the infinite loop. 

in _urllib2_fork.py in ProxyBasicAuthHandler (line 886) it defines
`auth_header = 'Proxy-authorization'`  (note the lowercase 'a')

In the function retry_http_basic_auth (_urllib2_fork.py, line 860),
the proxy-authorisation is added with normalization:
`newreq.add_header(self.auth_header, auth)`   -- add_header does header normalization and so "Proxy-Authorization" is added to the headers.

The function retry_http_basic_auth (_urllib2_fork.py, line 857), will keep on trying authentication
as long as the new password is different from the last.
It does this with the line `req.headers.get(self.auth_header, None)`
However headers.get does not do normalization.
Therefore it will look for the header 'Proxy-authorization' which does not exist (Proxy-Authorization does exist.)

potential fix1:
change headers.get to get_header, which does normalization
(urllib2_fork.py, line 854)
```
if req.get_header(self.auth_header, None) == auth:
    return None
```

potential fix2:
set `auth_header = 'Proxy-Authorization'` in class ProxyBasicAuthHandler (urllib2_fork.py, line 886)

Either of the fixes above solves the problem for me.

items.title: Error to open URL due certificate invalid
items.body:
Hi,

I could not open a URL that certificate is invalid. How could I bypass the certificate? (In browser I can open the page when I add an exception to this certificate)

I get this error:
urllib.error.URLError: <urlopen error EOF occurred in violation of protocol (_ssl.c:1056)>

I've already tried this solution:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30551400/disable-ssl-certificate-validation-in-mechanize
But didn't work for me.

Code:
```
import mechanize
br = mechanize.Browser()
br.set_handle_robots(False)

url = 'https://receita.fazenda.gov.br/Aplicacoes/SSL/ATCTA/CPF/ConsultaSituacao/ConsultaPublica.asp'
br.open(url)
```

Hi, 

pip3 install mechanize does not work. If python 3.x still not supported, please mention that in readme file. I saw some commit message include "python 3.x compatibility" so I tried to install it but I got the message "mechanize only works on python 2.x"

items.title: Order of request headers should be preserved
items.body:
Some sites can't be opened if request headers are in wrong order (it's probably a way to protect against automated tools like this one).
Right now setting headers with br.addheaders = headers doesn't guarantee the order of the headers as set (I checked it with Burp).

items.title: Request supporting javascript
items.body: I am doing a project that works with web form using mechanize. Unfortunately there are so many website using Javascript nowadays and mechanize can't work with it. I really hope devs can add Javascript supporting for project.

items.title: Request version tag
items.body: Time to tag a new version and publish to pypi?

items.title: meta http-equiv parser is forcing attribute values to lowercase
items.body:
I think it's this `attr_value.append(c.lower())` line here:
https://github.com/python-mechanize/mechanize/commit/ed613bee5345dee479204213cda66974109e8585#diff-92c6093c26c24fa2f4ed6dcaa7753963R316

I have a case-sensitive value in a meta refresh that is followed incorrectly:
```
INFO:mechanize.http_responses:<HTML>
<!-- [boring legal boilerplate omitted] -->
<HEAD>
      <meta HTTP-EQUIV='Refresh' CONTENT='0; URL=https://weblogon.csusb.edu/cas/login?method=POST&service=https://cmshr.cms.csusb.edu/psp/HSBPRD/?cmd=login%26languageCd=ENG%26userid=PS%26pwd=z'>
</HEAD>
</HTML>

*****************************************************
INFO:mechanize.http_responses:*****************************************************
send: 'GET /cas/login?method=post&service=https://cmshr.cms.csusb.edu/psp/hsbprd/?cmd=login%26languagecd=eng%26userid=ps%26pwd=z HTTP/1.1\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nHost: weblogon.csusb.edu\r\nConnection: close\r\nUser-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:45.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/45.0\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'
header: Date: Tue, 14 Aug 2018 19:47:59 GMT
```

In the above example, changing `HSBPRD` to `hsbprd` results in a bad request.

```
$ pip list | grep mechanize
mechanize     0.3.6
```

items.title: The latest version breaks on this site
items.body:
[Maryland Courts](http://casesearch.courts.state.md.us/inquiry/inquiry-index.jsp)
On this site, it opens with an agreement that one must check. In version 0.2.5, the following lines of code will bypass it, but in 0.3.6 it fails to find the `<input name="disclaimer" value="Y" type="checkbox">`.
```   
    br = mechanize.Browser()
    cj = cookielib.LWPCookieJar()
    br.set_cookiejar(cj)
    br.set_handle_equiv(True)
    br.set_handle_redirect(True)
    br.set_handle_referer(True)
    br.set_handle_robots(False)
    br.addheaders = [('User-agent', 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11;U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.0.1) Gecko/2008071615Fedora/3.0.1-1.fc9 Firefox/3.0.1')]
    br.open("http://casesearch.courts.state.md.us/inquiry/inquiry-index.jsp") 
    br.select_form(nr=0)
    br.find_control("disclaimer").items[0].selected=True
    br.submit()
```

items.title: FAQ says there are 4 solutions to JavaScript issue but lists only 2
items.body:
https://mechanize.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq.html#javascript-is-messing-up-my-web-scraping-what-do-i-do says

> If you come across this in a page you want to automate, you have four options

But I can only see two options.

items.title: Keep BeautifulSoup4 parser option, probably as a parameter to mechanize.Browser()
items.body: I found breakage on some existing script after upgrading mechanize from 0.2.5 to the latest version. `git bisect` led me to 75f3690d12b793e05fc118b9944c6753a0dc8a7a and it seems that particular web page can't be parsed correctly with html5lib. I have no control over that web page and I know it's pretty old in terms of web standards used, but BS4 seems to have better compatibility with it. I feel there can be more websites/pages in this category.

items.title: Weird hidden unicode inputs to forms causes form submission to fail
items.body:
Consider the following form:

```html
<form action="/some_action" accept-charset="UTF-8" method="post">
    <input name="utf8" type="hidden" value="✓" />
    <input type="text" name="user_input" id="user_input" />
</form>
```

Attempting to submit the form always fails for me due to the weird hidden utf-8 input:

```
# ... application logic for submit above
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 683, in submit
    return self.open(self.click(*args, **kwds))
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_mechanize.py", line 673, in click
    request = self.form.click(*args, **kwds)
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2238, in click
    self._request_class)
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2456, in _click
    return control._click(self, coord, return_type, request_class)
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 1505, in _click
    r = form._switch_click(return_type, request_class)
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2525, in _switch_click
    req_data = self._request_data()
  File "/v/rootenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mechanize/_form_controls.py", line 2499, in _request_data
    return (uri, urllib.urlencode(self._pairs()),
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/urllib.py", line 1347, in urlencode
    v = quote_plus(str(v))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u2713' in position 0: ordinal not in range(128)
```

items.title: TypeError: parse() got an unexpected keyword argument 'transport_encoding'
items.body:
Hi!

I am trying to use mechanize to automate logging into a webpage but I have been stuck on this issue for a few days now.  I keep getting the TypeError listed above.  I have tried upgrading html5lib with no avail.

This is my code:
import mechanize
browser = mechanize.Browser()
browser.set_handle_robots(False)
cookies = mechanize.CookieJar()
browser.set_cookiejar(cookies)
browser.addheaders = [('User-agent', 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.7 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/7.0.517.41 Safari/534.7')]
browser.set_handle_refresh(False)

url = 'http://www.facebook.com/login.php'
browser.open(url)
browser.select_form(nr = 0)       #This is login-password form -> nr = number = 0
browser.form['email'] = YourLogin
browser.form['pass'] = YourPassw
response = self.browser.submit()
print response.read()

I really need this to work for a project so any help will be greatly appreciated!!!!

Thanks
Conner

items.title: <input name="a" value/> gets interpreted wrongly
items.body:
`<input name="a" value/>` gets interpreted as `<input name="a" value="value"/>`. Is this desired behaviour?

I agree it is an erratic `<form>`, but I think it's more logical to interpret it as an empty `value` rather than as a `value="value"`

items.title: Feeding some URL to Browser.open() ends up in UnicodeDecodeError
items.body:
Trying to execute this code:

```
browser = mechanize.Browser()
browser.set_handle_robots(False)
browser.open('http://musicmp3spb.org/album/plays_the_sound_of_philadelphia_a_tribute_to_kenny_gamble_leon_huff.html')
```

leads to UnicodeDecodeError. Ths link is up and running just click at http://musicmp3spb.org/album/plays_the_sound_of_philadelphia_a_tribute_to_kenny_gamble_leon_huff.html.I believe this has something ton do with this issue:

http://bugs.python.org/issue11898 

but applying a patch from it to httplib (http://bugs.python.org/file21747/python-2.7.1-fix-httplib-UnicodeDecodeError.patch) did not help.

Also this advice: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1525295/how-to-fix-encoding-in-python-mechanize (the last one about _factory) was of no help either. I believe the problem is that part of what this page returns is cp1251 a Mechanize thinks is utf-8 or even ascii. How can I fix that? Is there a way to explicitely say Mechanize that this page is in that encoding? There is no Mechanize available for Python 3 so I cannot fix that just by switcing Python version. Would have to go to Beuatiful Soup instead but Mechanize is simpler for my needs so I would really prefer to stick to it.

Can you help with this annoying bug? Here some more description on my page where I use mechanize to scramble songs: https://github.com/xor512/musicmp3spb.org/issues/1

from mechanize import ParseResponse, urlopen, urljoin

items.body: There is  any docs about mechanize.Response ?

items.title: TypeError: parse() got an unexpected keyword argument 'transport_encoding'
items.body:
mechnize 0.3.1
html5lib .999

 TypeError: parse() got an unexpected keyword argument 'transport_encoding'

what ver of html5lib is mechanize built on?

v 0.999 is:
def parse(doc, treebuilder="etree", encoding=None, namespaceHTMLElements=True)

v 0.99999999:
def parse(doc, treebuilder="etree", namespaceHTMLElements=True, **kwargs)

I think this is the issue.

items.title: Missing RobustFactory
items.body:
Looks like the 3.x version doesn't have ```RobustFactory``` anymore?

```
...
    mechanize.Browser.__init__(self, factory=mechanize.RobustFactory())
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'RobustFactory'
```

https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/issues/218

items.title: Cant set `host` header
items.body:
Hi!

Trying to set http header `host` when using `Browser`, but its not work!

```py
import mechanize


b = mechanize.Browser()
b.set_handle_robots(False)
addheaders = [('Test-Header', 'Test'),
              ('Host', 'test.local')]

b.addheaders = addheaders

b.open('http://localhost:1024/')
```

In my localhost I run the following:

```sh
nc -l 1024
```

Then start my python code and get:

```
GET / HTTP/1.1
Accept-Encoding: identity
Host: localhost:1024
Connection: close
Test-Header: Test
```

Why `Host` is equal `localhost:1024`? :(

My env:

MacOS
Mechanize Version: 0.3.1

items.title: Allow JSON as a valid response type
items.body: Useful when trying to test REST services. This flag should default to False for backwards compatibility.

items.title: ImportError with html5lib on v0.3.1
items.body:
Looks like `html5lib` has been introduced as a depency at: https://github.com/python-mechanize/mechanize/commit/75f3690d12b793e05fc118b9944c6753a0dc8a7a

This is easy to reproduce:

```
>>> import mechanize
>>> br = mechanize.Browser()
>>> br.open('https://example.com')
>>> br.select_form('whatever')
```
An easy workaround is just to install the missing library with: `pip install html5lib`. However, I would expect that such internal dependency would be already installed along mechanize.

What about adding the following to `setup()` at `setup.py`?

```
install_requires=['html5lib']
```
Or with a fix version:

```
install_requires=['html5lib==0.999999999']
```
